The ultra-rich are claiming an increasing share of global wealth, report shows
subhead: The wealth of the ultra-rich is undergoing a historic surge. This is the key takeaway of the third major report of the World Inequality Lab co-directed by French economist Thomas Piketty, which emphasizes how political choices can reverse these trends.

headline: Trapped by old treaties with Russia, Europeans face the threat of heavy financial penalties
Devastation and trauma linger in Sri Lanka after Cyclone Ditwah
Japan sees disinformation spread as right-wing influence grows
subhead: Japan's political and social crises have fueled a climate of anxiety and a surge in right-wing radicalization, notably among young people. The right has taken advantage of this to whitewash the facts of the war (1931-1945).

headline: Luigi Mangione's notes revealed in court: 'Pluck eyebrows,' 'FBI slower overnight'
subhead: The notes found at Luigi Mangione's arrest at a Pennsylvania McDonald's, shown on Monday at a pretrial hearing, included a hand-drawn map and survival tactics. Mangione has pleaded not guilty to murder charges for the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson last December.

headline: 'American-style capitalism is inseparable from its philanthropic side'
subhead: Michael Dell, founder of the tech giant Dell Technologies, has just announced a $6.25 billion donation to American children, offering a pure lesson in philanthropic capitalism, writes Le Monde's Nicolas Chapuis.

headline: Kyiv, the sleepless city under bombardment
subhead: Day after day, Russian forces wage a psychological war on the residents of the Ukrainian capital, often leaving them without electricity and deprived of sleep.

President Nicusor Dan: 'In Romania, we do not have a real policy to defend against disinformation'
subhead: Romania borders Ukraine and is at the front line against Russian interference, which led to the cancellation of the presidential election a year ago. In an interview with Le Monde, President Nicusor Dan, elected in May, revisits the matter and discusses the differences between Europe and the US regarding the war in Ukraine.

headline: Illegal crosses in French public spaces reignite debates over church-state separation
subhead: Calvaries installed on public land in towns in the Alps, on the Mediterranean coast and on the island of Corsica, sometimes with the help of far-right identitarian movements, have rekindled long-standing tensions around France's 1905 law separating churches and state.

headline: France's far-right Rassemblement National wants to reopen brothels
subhead: MP Jean-Philippe Tanguy, who is preparing a bill to create cooperatives managed by sex workers themselves, says penalizing customers has worsened the situation of sex workers.
